sentence.Network_en: Not everyone joined the counterculture, not everyone demonstrated, dropped out, took drugs, or dodged the draft.
sentence.Network_cn: 不是所有人都加入反主流文化群体，不是所有人都示威游行，退学，吸毒，或逃避服兵役。

sentence.Network_en: An eccentric or nonconformist person, especially a member of a counterculture.
sentence.Network_cn: 离经叛道之人、反常或不符合常规之人, 尤指反主流文化的成员.

sentence.Network_en: But in the 1960 s a new force developed called the counterculture.
sentence.Network_cn: 但是在1960年代一个新的力量发展呼叫反主流文化.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 那些反文化（counterculture）、次文化、普普艺术、超级巨星、药物、灯光、迪斯可──任何我们认为是「年轻又热门」的事情──大 …

甚至是冷战和反传统文化（counterculture）为漫画所带来的直接效应，其中包括了漫画家的发表从报纸副刊，转换到漫画书，甚至是 …
社会和文化运动相左——如反主流文化运动 （counterculture）、女权主义、同性恋运动、与种族分离主义等等。

list.abs: ...除罪化的过程，但由于受到沃芬顿报告与1960 年代反文化运动 (counterculture movement) 与学生运动 (student activism) 等潮流，成.

entry.tran: 反主流文化;反正统文化
entry.def: Counter-culture is a set of values, ideas, and ways of behaving that are completely different from those of the rest of society.

example.tran: 英国反主流文化的历史

entry.def: A counter-culture is a group in society whose values, ideas, and ways of behaving are completely different from those of the rest of society.

example.ex: Not everyone joined the counterculture, not everyone demonstrated, dropped out, took drugs, or dodged the draft.
example.tran: 不是所有人都加入反主流文化群体，不是所有人都示威游行，退学，吸毒，或逃避服兵役。

means.word_mean: 1. a culture with lifestyles and values opposed to those of the established culture
